events.originalText: The Hong Kong–based file-sharing website Megaupload was shut down by the FBI.
events.subtitle: File sharing
events.headline: Megaupload Shut Down by FBI

events.originalText: Turkish-Armenian journalist and human-rights activist Hrant Dink was assassinated by a Turkish nationalist in Istanbul.
events.subtitle: Hrant Dink
events.headline: Journalist Hrant Dink Assassinated in Istanbul

events.originalText: A four-man team, using only skis and kites, completed a 1,093-mile (1,759 km) trek to reach the Southern Pole of Inaccessibility, the first people to get there since 1967, and the first to do so on foot.
events.subtitle: Snowkiting
events.headline: Team Completes Trek to Southern Pole of Inaccessibility

events.originalText: In the deadliest aviation accident in Slovak history, an Antonov An-24 operated by the Slovak Air Force crashed in northern Hungary, killing 42 of the 43 people on board.
events.subtitle: Antonov An-24
events.headline: Deadliest Aviation Accident in Slovak History

events.originalText: The key of Majulah Singapura, the national anthem of Singapore, was changed to F major.
events.subtitle: Majulah Singapura
events.headline: Singapore National Anthem Key Changed to F Major

events.originalText: A tank barge and a tug grounded on a beach in Rhode Island, causing a spill of an estimated 828,000 U.S. gallons (3,130,000 L) of home heating oil.
events.subtitle: Barge
events.headline: Oil Spill in Rhode Island After Barge Grounding

events.originalText: Iva Toguri (pictured), convicted of treason for broadcasting Japanese propaganda, was granted a full pardon by U.S. president Gerald Ford.
events.subtitle: Iva Toguri D'Aquino
events.headline: Iva Toguri Pardoned by President Ford

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 6.8 Ms struck northern Himachal Pradesh in India, causing extensive damage to the region.
events.subtitle: 1975 Kinnaur earthquake
events.headline: 6.8 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Himachal Pradesh, India

events.originalText: The French newspaper L'Aurore revealed that the former Nazi SS officer Klaus Barbie (pictured), the "Butcher of Lyon", had been found to be living in Peru.
events.subtitle: L'Aurore (newspaper founded 1944)
events.headline: Former Nazi Klaus Barbie Found Living in Peru

events.originalText: The American Civil Liberties Union was founded by the directors of the National Civil Liberties Bureau.
events.subtitle: American Civil Liberties Union
events.headline: ACLU Founded by National Civil Liberties Bureau Directors

events.originalText: World War I: The first major attack of the German bombing campaign against Britain took place when Zeppelins bombed several towns in Norfolk.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: German Zeppelins Bomb Towns in Norfolk

events.originalText: A deed was recorded for David Hanbury to sell Island No. 2 in northern California to his brother John for $10 ($326.00 in 2022).
events.subtitle: Deed
events.headline: Deed Recorded for Sale of Island in California

events.originalText: The Batavian Republic was established the day after William V fled the Dutch Republic as a result of the Batavian Revolution in Amsterdam.
events.subtitle: Batavian Republic
events.headline: Batavian Republic Established After Dutch Revolution

events.originalText: War of the League of Cambrai: Troops led by Pope Julius II captured Mirandola after a brief siege.
events.subtitle: War of the League of Cambrai
events.headline: Pope Julius II Troops Capture Mirandola

events.originalText: Hundred Years' War: The siege of Rouen ended with English troops capturing the city from Norman French forces.
events.subtitle: Hundred Years' War
events.headline: English Troops Capture Rouen in Hundred Years' War
